channel.title: Runescape - Emails
channel.description:
I recently got an account that has an email registered to it.
I want to change the email, but the only way I can find is by making it send an email to the email registered, which I do not have a password for. Is there any other way to change a email

item.title: Runescape - Emails
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Whackatre, post:1, topic:455112”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=557219.msg4082013#msg4082013 date=1345443907]

^ technically they are both fruit xD

and sorry at name lol david and I been pming a lot today

Anyway, the point is is I can verify who you are on this forum using your ISP fairly easily. People rarely change ISPs. Nevertheless, you are also fairly easy to track because you have a static IP (for example, your account on here only has like 3-4 IPs connected to it). Other users (say, from the old bigpond hostname from some crappy aussie ISP) have a dynamic IP. They dont change ISPs, but some of their accounts on here may have over 100 unique IPs associated with it. There’s accurate way to track/verify a user based on IP alone, unless you can verify it’s static (and even then, in terms of consistently using multiple ISPs, that approach goes wry). Your only option is to try and use the most commonly used ISP(s) for an account to try and verify its authenticity.
[/quote]
Only four IP addresses from Loveandpower’s 8307 posts?

How many IP addresses have I posted from?[/quote]

Only 5.

Read full topic

item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

I probably have my posts linked to 4 or 5 devices too considering how often I use my phone or friends computers for a quick post here.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape - Emails
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:11, topic:454351”]^ technically they are both fruit xD

and sorry at name lol david and I been pming a lot today[/quote]

Anyway, the point is is I can verify who you are on this forum using your ISP fairly easily. People rarely change ISPs. Nevertheless, you are also fairly easy to track because you have a static IP (for example, your account on here only has like 3-4 IPs connected to it). Other users (say, from the old bigpond hostname from some crappy aussie ISP) have a dynamic IP. They dont change ISPs, but some of their accounts on here may have over 100 unique IPs associated with it. There’s accurate way to track/verify a user based on IP alone, unless you can verify it’s static (and even then, in terms of consistently using multiple ISPs, that approach goes wry). Your only option is to try and use the most commonly used ISP(s) for an account to try and verify its authenticity.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape - Emails
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Loveandpower:

^ response was targeted at david lol

What? My name isn’t david, mate.

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:7, topic:454351”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=557219.msg4081698#msg4081698 date=1345424255]

ask on their support boards but as others have said as they can check original ip they probably won’t help you!

Considering that would screw everyone without a static IP, I doubt it.
[/quote]not really
why do you think one of the questions on manual recovery asks "current isp " cause comcast is only dynamic now for residents.[/quote]

ISP is not IP. IPs may change for a given ISP, which is called a dynamic IP. You first brought up apples, but now you are countering with oranges.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape - Emails
item.dc:creator: @Anieli Anieli
item.description:
@Anieli wrote:

[quote=“kingman002, post:3, topic:454351”][quote author=Anieli link=topic=557219.msg4077817#msg4077817 date=1345039694]
You could email support@jagex.com and explain the situation to them, You may need to recover your own account though before the email can be changed. It takes them like a week to reply aswell.
[/quote]
I wouldn’t recommend that. They would probably lock/ban the account because it seems like you either hacked, traded/bought the account which is against their rules.[/quote]

Whenever i have emailed them they have been very helpful. They will lock your account if you ask them too but unless you email them saying you think you are being recovered then they normally wouldn’t lock it.

They even unlocked my account when it became locked for no reason and would not recover using correct recoveries and from the same address the account was created from despite me having read several times on the forums Jagex cannot unlock accounts as they must be recovered.

Read full topic

Anieli:

You could email support@jagex.com and explain the situation to them, You may need to recover your own account though before the email can be changed. It takes them like a week to reply aswell.

I wouldn’t recommend that. They would probably lock/ban the account because it seems like you either hacked, traded/bought the account which is against their rules.
